article.title: Cool App-titude: BOINC
article.author: Rachel Lilly
article.text: Got spare Android power to share? The BOINC app lets you donate spare processing power to run jobs for scientific research projects, from a search for more effective AIDS therapies to the discovery of new pulsars. BOINC computes when your device is plugged in and charging and transfers data over Wi-Fi, so it will not run down your battery or take up data. Created by researchers at the University of California Berkeley, the BOINC (Berkeley Open Infrastructure for Network Computing) program has been harnessing donated desktop computing power since 2002. With the new app, they hope to use smartphone and tablet power too. Users can specify which project they would like to support. Download the Android app from Google Play and the Kindle Fire tablet app from the Amazon Appstore.
